p:
It was reported that E. grandiflorum has good antioxidant potential, and could act as natural antioxidants in pharmaceutical preparations, foods and cosmetics, and our results are in agreement with the findings of Yang et al.,
51 who also found the good radical scavenging activity of Epimedium species. Moreover, results also explored that the increase in the reductive capacity is directly proportional to the concentration of plant extracts. In addition, it was also reported that the hydroethanolic extract of E. grandiflorum contains phyto compounds responsible for reducing potential, a significant indicator of its antioxidant capacity.
52, 53
